Column Comment.0: STRATIGRAPHIC ACQUISITION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphicacquisition.
Column Comment.1: FIELD STATION ID: unique identifier for the stratigraphic field station.
Column Comment.2: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.3: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.4: INTERPRETATION IDENTIFIER: added to enable a single strat unit to be identifiedmore than once as part of a stratigraphic column. Multiple occurances may occur formany reasons, including folding, faulting or a non-vertical interpretation of the stratcolumn.
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: CORE ID: Unique identifier for a well core
Column Comment.7: CORE SOURCE: Source of the core data.
Column Comment.8: DESCRIPTION: description of the relationship between the project and the othercomponent.
Column Comment.9: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.10: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.11: INFORMATION ITEM ID: Unique identifier for the information item.
Column Comment.12: INFORMATION ITEM SUBTYPE: the type of information item. May be one of Thevalid types of Information item as defined by check constraints.
Column Comment.13: CURVE IDENTIFIER: Unique identification number assigned to the curve or trace.
Column Comment.14: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.15: PROJECT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the project.
Column Comment.16: REMARK: narrative remarks about the project component.
Column Comment.17: SEISMIC SET: A seismic set is a super type of various types of seismic collections.
Column Comment.18: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row of data.Valid entries include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY, SEIS_PLAN,SEIS_WELL, SEIS_PROC_SET, SEIS_INTERP_SET or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.19: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.20: STRATIGRAPHIC COLUMN IDENTIFIER: The ID assigned to the stratigraphiccolumn.
Column Comment.21: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.22: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.24: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.26: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.29: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
